Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Marketing, Advertising and PR

abstract.p: Continuing ad campaign for Templeton money manager Dr J Mark Mobius is going head to head with new campaign for Kemper Funds global strategist Dr Robert J Froehlich; both men sport clean-shaven heads and natty suits; photos (M)

block.p: Yul Brynner chic is spreading among pitchmen for global investing. The continuing advertising and publicity campaign for Dr. J. Mark Mobius, the famed Templeton money manager and author, is now going head to head with a new one for Dr. Robert J. Froehlich, global strategist for Kemper Funds.

Dr. Mobius is already second in ubiquity, behind only Peter Lynch of Fidelity Investments. But where Mr. Lynch preaches the reassuringly sage, ''Know what you own, and why you own it,'' Dr. Mobius projects a whiff of intrigue. Know what you own? Dr. Mobius invests in Malaysia, Indonesia and Russia, the terrain not of widows and orphans, but of swashbuckling capitalists and intrepid risk-takers.

Yul Brynner chic is spreading among pitchmen for global investing. The continuing advertising and publicity campaign for Dr. J. Mark Mobius, the famed Templeton money manager and author, is now going head to head with a new one for Dr. Robert J. Froehlich, global strategist for Kemper Funds.

Dr. Mobius is already second in ubiquity, behind only Peter Lynch of Fidelity Investments. But where Mr. Lynch preaches the reassuringly sage, ''Know what you own, and why you own it,'' Dr. Mobius projects a whiff of intrigue. Know what you own? Dr. Mobius invests in Malaysia, Indonesia and Russia, the terrain not of widows and orphans, but of swashbuckling capitalists and intrepid risk-takers.

In the new Kemper campaign, one advertisement features Dr. Froehlich lifting a boulder, offering the insight that ''you can't turn over too many rocks.'' In another, he sits between two gorillas, representing China and Japan.
Both men sport clean-shaven pates. Both dress in natty suits, hankie in chest pocket. Both have Sphinx-like gazes.

Taking a cue from the Austin Powers movies, is Dr. Froehlich playing Mini-Me to Dr. Mobius? Not so, says Howard Schneider, Kemper's marketing director, noting that Dr. Froehlich is ''a well-known personality'' in his own right.
